meanings.definition: A person who takes care of a building or land.
meanings.sent1: The caretaker of the park waters the plants every morning.
meanings.sent2: The caretaker of the school ensures that the classrooms are clean and tidy.
meanings.sent3: The caretaker of the zoo accidentally let the monkeys loose during feeding time!
meanings.sent4: The caretaker of the old mansion held the keys to its hidden secrets.
meanings.sent5: The caretaker of the garden whispered to the flowers as she tended to them lovingly.

meanings.definition: A person who takes care of someone else, such as a child or elderly person.
meanings.sent1: The caretaker of the baby rocked him gently to sleep.
meanings.sent2: The caretaker of the elderly woman helped her with daily tasks.
meanings.sent3: The caretaker of the mischievous toddler had to chase him around the house.
meanings.sent4: The caretaker of the group guided them through the forest like a wise owl.
meanings.sent5: The caretaker of the sick patient comforted them with kind words and a warm smile.
